meanings.definition: A medication used to treat asthma and other respiratory conditions by opening up the airways.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed albuterol to help with my breathing problems.
meanings.sent2: I always carry my albuterol inhaler in case of an asthma attack.
meanings.sent3: When the albuterol kicked in, I felt like a superhero with super lungs!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like albuterol for my soul, opening up new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The albuterol worked like magic, clearing the airways and bringing relief.

meanings.definition: To administer albuterol through an inhaler for quick relief of breathing difficulties.
meanings.sent1: Remember to albuterol your inhaler before using it.
meanings.sent2: She albuteroled the inhaler and took a deep breath.
meanings.sent3: He albuteroled the inhaler with a dramatic flair, pretending to be a scientist.
meanings.sent4: The music albuteroled her senses, calming her racing heart.
meanings.sent5: Albuteroling the inhaler felt like a small victory in the battle for breath.
